clinical_study.brief_title: Carnoy`s Solution Versus Formalin in Rectal Cancer Specimens Following Neoadjuvant Chemoradiation: a Randomized Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Lymph Node Yield After Specimen Fixation With Carnoy`s Solution and 10% Neutral Buffered Formaldehyde in Patients With Rectal Cancer Specimens Following Neoadjuvant Chemoradiation: a Randomized Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto do Cancer do Estado de São Paulo

clinical_study.source: Instituto do Cancer do Estado de São Paulo

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the number of lymph nodes dissected in rectal cancer specimens following fixation with 10% neutral buffered formaldehyde or Carnoy's solution. Half of the specimens with be fixed in each solution.

detailed_description.textblock: Carnoy's solution is a tissue fixative who has alcohol allowing for fat clearing along with tissue fixation. Previous studies demonstrated this ability and the investigators introduced this for patients with rectal cancer who has undergone preoperative chemoradiaton. This subgroup of patients have a very low lymph node yield.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 10 days - accessed with the pathological report for each specimen
primary_outcome.description: Primary outcome will be the total number of lymph nodes dissected in each specimen

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 days - accessed with the pathological report for each specimen
secondary_outcome.description: Secondary outcome will be measured in minutes, counting from the start to the end of the dissection

arm_group.description: Specimens will be fixed for 24-48hours in 10% neutral buffered formaldehyde and then dissected for lymph nodes.
Specimens will be fixed for 24-48hours in Carno'ys solution and then dissected for lymph nodes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Rectal cancer
- Long course neoadjuvant chemoradiation
- Low anterior resection with total mesorectal excision
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous rectal surgery
- Incomplete neoadjuvant chemoradiation
- Refuse to sign the informed consent
- Multivisceral resection
